data.title: SCHAKOWSKY AND MEMBERS OF CONGRESS URGE UKRAINIAN GOVERNMENT TO USE OPPORTUNITY TO HOLD NAZI WAR CRIMINAL ACCOUNTABLE

data.text:
WASHINGTON, D.C. - U.S. Representative Jan Schakowsky (D-IL) today urged the government of Ukraine to "take in" Bohdan Koziy, a Nazi war criminal who has been ordered to leave of Costa Rica after living in that country for 15 years.

In a letter to Ukrainian President H.E. Leonid Kuchma, Schakowsky and more than 20 of her colleagues urged the President to take in Koziy, who is a Ukrainian native, and to consider this opportunity to hold him accountable for his crimes.

They wrote, " Since Mr. Koziy is a native of Ukraine, it is our hope that your government will cooperate with the government of Costa Rica and take in Mr. Koziy. In the interest of justice, we urge you not to prevent Mr. Koziy from returning to Ukraine and consider the opportunity presented by the Government of Costa Rica to hold him accountable for his crimes."

Koziy was stripped of his U.S. citizenship in 1982 after his identity was revealed, and he was identified as a Nazi war criminal. He took part in numerous anti-Jewish crimes in the Ukraine and was a member of the Nazi-run Ukrainian police.

The members added in their letter, "He was found by a U.S. Federal Court to have single-handedly murdered a 4 year-old Jewish girl by shooting her at point-blank range as she pleaded with him for her life outside a police station in Lysiec, Ukraine, in the autumn of 1943. German courts have also found that he personally carried out this and other crimes."

A copy of the letter is attached.

{attached}

March 23, 2000

The Honorable H.E. Leonid Kuchma

President of Ukraine

Kiev, Ukraine

Dear Mr. President:

Bohdan Koziy is a Nazi war criminal who has enjoyed undeserved sanctuary in

Costa Rica for the past 15 years, and now that government has ordered him to

leave the country.

Since Mr. Koziy is a native of Ukraine, it is our hope that your government

will cooperate with the government of Costa Rica and take in Mr. Koziy.

He was stripped of his American citizenship in 1982 after his identity was

established in U.S. courts and confirmed by the German government. He was

found by a U.S. Federal Court to have single-handedly murdered a

4 year-old Jewish girl by shooting her at point-blank range as she

pleaded with him for her life outside a police station in Lysiec, Ukraine,

in the autumn of 1943. German courts have also found that he personally

carried out this and other crimes.

He also took part in numerous other anti-Jewish actions during the war as a

member of the notorious Nazi-run Ukrainian police. The Office of Special

Investigations of the U.S. Justice Department attempted to expel him from

the country but Koziy fled to Costa Rica in 1984 before his court-ordered

deportation to the Soviet Union could be carried out.

In the interest of justice, we urge you not to prevent Mr. Koziy from returning to Ukraine and consider the opportunity presented by the Government of Costa Rica to hold him accountable for his crimes. Thank you for your consideration. We look forward to your response.

Sincerely,

Jan Schakwosky

Member of Congress
